pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:1.1: Nuns’ suspension 7, 8, and 9 are identical to the monks’ suspension 5{MS.1.1242}, 8{MS.1.1573}, and 9{MS.1.1630} respectively, with appropriate gender changes.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.1.59: _Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ_. The Pali text just says _dukkaṭa_, without specifying that it is an _āpatti_, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the _dukkaṭa_ is annulled if you commit the full offense of _saṅghādisesa_. The implication is that _dukkaṭa_ should be read as _āpatti dukkaṭassa_, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss10:2.3.6: MS says the “seventh offense,” but since I am including the rules that the nuns have in common with the monks in the count, I get “tenth offense” instead. The same adjustment is required for the next three rules.
